thread.title: Exclusive: Betty Boop gets brand new cartoons, starrin Zac Posen
thread.title_full: Exclusive: Betty Boop gets brand new cartoons, starrin Zac Posen

author: USA TODAY
title: Exclusive: Betty Boop gets brand new cartoons, starrin Zac Posen
text:
Exclusive: Betty Boop gets brand new cartoons, starrin Zac Posen Carly Mallenbaum , USA TODAY Published 9:22 a.m. ET Feb. 10, 2017 | Updated 52 minutes ago 36 Shares x Share Designer Zac Posen, who's releasing two dresses inspired by Betty Boop, also co-stars with the animated star in a series of cartoons. The first one is called 'Betty Goes A-Posen.' 
Betty Boop, the flirty cartoon character who first batted her eyelashes onscreen in 1930, is back with a signature Pantone color (Betty Boop Red, natch), a Mac lipstick shade (also red), two dresses (you can guess the color) and three animations that feature the designer of those dresses, Zac Posen. USA TODAY can exclusively reveal the first of these new cartoons. 
In the premiere short, called "Zac Goes A-Posen," Betty Boop shows up in black-and-white New York City, flustered. Her cab spits her and her dog, Pudgy, out, and she's ruffled, until she hears a cry for help. The voice might sound familiar.
